title: Biden administration cancels oil and gas leases in Arctic wildlife refuge
description: The move comes as the Biden administration seeks to expand protections against oil and gas development on public lands.

title: Western officials visit UAE in efforts to halt exports to Russia: Report
description: The Wall Street Journal initially reported plans to jointly press the UAE to halt shipments of goods to Russia.

title: Blinken hails Ukraine counteroffensive as US announces $1bn in new aid
description: The new US aid would include HIMARS missile systems, Javelin weapons, Abrams tanks as well as humanitarian assistance.

title: Greek ferry captain, three seamen charged over death of tardy passenger
description: The incident, captured on a video shared on social media, sparked anger across the maritime country.

title: At least 32 civilians killed in Sudan army strikes: Activists
description: Head of Sudan's army officially dissolves Rapid Support Forces, who he has been fighting since April.

title: California state legislature passes bill banning caste-based discrimination
description: Dalit rights groups hail the vote as a landmark victory in their bid to stop casteism from taking root in the US.

title: Migrant workers in Canada ‘vulnerable’ to modern-day slavery: UN expert
description: UN special rapporteur says he is 'deeply disturbed' by migrant workers' accounts of abuse and exploitation in Canada.

title: ‘Bizarre’ long-legged bird-like dinosaur has scientists enthralled in China
description: Scientists have unearthed in Fujian Province the fossil of a Jurassic Period dinosaur named Fujianvenator prodigiosus.

title: Former Mossad chief: Israel enforcing apartheid system against Palestinians
description: Tamir Pardo becomes latest former senior official to claim Israel's treatment of Palestinians amounts to apartheid.

title: Romania claims parts of possible Russian drone fell on its territory
description: Defence Minister Angel Tilvar said possible drone parts were discovered near border between Romania and Ukraine.

title: Trump liable for defamation in writer Carroll’s second lawsuit: US judge
description: Ruling means upcoming civil trial will concern only how much more Donald Trump has to pay E Jean Carroll.

title: Nigeria election tribunal upholds President Bola Tinubu victory
description: The Nigerian presidential election tribunal upholds victory of Bola Tinubu, elected in March 2023.

title: Missile strikes crowded market in eastern Ukraine
description: Child among 16 killed in Russian attack in Kostiantynivka, Ukrainian officials say; no immediate comment by Russia.

title: China President Xi’s absence from G20 won’t affect summit consensus: India
description: Indian Foreign Minister Jaishankar says Xi skipping G20 summit has nothing to do with ties with New Delhi.

title: US imposes sanctions on leaders in Sudan’s RSF over ‘extensive’ abuses
description: Washington accuses paramilitary group's deputy commander and top general in West Darfur of human rights violations.

title: WHO sees ‘concerning’ COVID trends before winter as hospitalisations rise
description: The UN health agency says many countries stopped reporting COVID data and called for more vaccinations and surveillance.

title: African leaders seek global taxes for climate change at Nairobi summit
description: The Nairobi Declaration represents a united front for Africa before negotiations for more funding at COP28.

title: Spain’s Jenni Hermoso files legal complaint against Rubiales over kiss
description: Prosecutor's office says the footballer filed the case against the football chief on Tuesday.

title: Fierce storm in southern Brazil kills at least 27 people
description: Governor of Rio Grande do Sul says death toll from extratropical cyclone is state's highest due to a climate event.

title: Fifty years after Chile’s coup, the search for truth continues
description: As 1973 coup still reverberates, a man is pushing for full history of US role in Augusto Pinochet's rise and fall.

title: Torrential rains kill at least 11 people in Greece, Turkey and Bulgaria
description: Severe rainstorms lash parts of Greece, Turkey and Bulgaria, prompting floods and landslides.

title: Civilians reported killed as Russia shells outdoor market in east Ukraine
description: Russia allegedly targeted the city of Kostiantynivka, killing and wounding many, Ukrainian officials say.

title: Displaced Syrians forced to build hideouts in the caves of Jabal al-Zawiya
description: Al-Zawiya's caves shelter Syrian families whose homes have been under attack as regime forces hound Idlib.

title: Amid abaya ban, French school sends girl home for wearing kimono: Lawyer
description: Human rights lawyer who plans to file complaint says 15-year-old was asked to leave school for wearing Japanese garment.

title: At the scene of the annual graverobbing of Dr Martin Luther King Jr
description: Colonists continue to steal from Dr King's messages and memory to advance the system he was killed for opposing.

title: Hedi Nouira: The transformer of Tunisia’s economy
description: Power politics in Tunisia in the 1970s and Prime Minister Hedi Nouira's battle to bring prosperity to his country.

title: South Africa ‘held to ransom’ by big pharma, overcharged for COVID vaccines
description: J&J, Pfizer charged South Africa between 15 and 33 percent more for COVID vaccine doses, contracts reveal.

title: Why is the Shalamcheh-Basra railroad so important to Iran and Iraq?
description: Tehran and Baghdad begin construction of rail link after decades of planning, but challenges remain.

title: Main Afghanistan-Pakistan border crossing closed after guards exchange fire
description: Gun battle erupts between Pakistani and Afghan forces, shutting busiest trade crossing between the South Asian nations.

title: ‘It will really make me sad’: Georgia plans to ban commercial surrogacy
description: The Georgian government has proposed a ban to prevent foreign couples from accessing commercial surrogacy.

title: India or Bharat: What’s behind the dispute over the country’s name?
description: A change to the Sanskrit name is backed by PM Modi's BJP, which says the word 'India' is a symbol of colonial slavery.

title: ‘Justice denied’: Victims’ families slam UK’s Northern Ireland legacy bill
description: The UK's proposed law will shut down new probes of atrocities committed during 30 years of conflict in Northern Ireland.

title: Sudanese asylum seekers sleep rough by Libya’s UNHCR office
description: Many refugees remain without shelter after making the arduous journey to Libya from war-torn Sudan.

title: Netanyahu’s call to deport Eritreans shows Israel’s racism is global
description: International law bars Israel from pushing Eritreans out. But that, as Palestinians know well, hasn't stopped it before.

title: Australia names injured quartet in experienced Cricket World Cup squad
description: Australian selectors have named an experienced Cricket World Cup squad leaning towards pace bowlers and all-rounders.

title: Eritreans in Tel Aviv unsure if they fear Netanyahu or other Eritreans more
description: Israeli right calls them 'infiltrators', and PM demands deportations after pro-, anti-gov't Eritreans fight in streets.

title: Russia voices concern as Armenia prepares to exercise with US troops
description: Drills will prepare units for international peacekeeping missions, says Yerevan, as ties with Moscow appear strained.

title: UN announces ‘climate breakdown’ after record summer heat
description: Scientists blame ever warming human-caused climate change from the burning of coal, oil and natural gas.

title: East Africa leaders extend regional troop mandate in DR Congo
description: Soldiers to stay until December 8 as local opposition grows to peacekeepers and tensions between DRC  and Rwanda simmer.

title: Why is Pakistan upset over the handling of Asia Cup cricket event?
description: Confusion over hosting of the tournament has led to last-minute changes and bitterness between cricket officials.

title: Six billion tonnes of sand are extracted from world’s oceans each year
description: UN warns the scale of dredging has a devastating effect on biodiversity and coastal communities.

title: Photos: Heavy rainstorms trigger flooding in Greece, Turkey, Bulgaria
description: The storms come on the heels of major summer wildfires that hit Greece over the past few weeks.

title: ‘Don’t come back without Nader’: Search for Tunisian lost en route to Italy
description: Rashid is on a desperate quest to find his brother Nader, lost at sea, who left Tunisia by boat to join him in Italy.

title: Climate issues unresolved as recently flooded New Delhi hosts G20 summit
description: Climate ministers of G20 nations ended last meeting in July without resolving major disagreements on climate policies.

title: Sri Lanka to probe allegation of intelligence complicity in 2019 bombings
description: British TV report alleges a top Sri Lankan intelligence official hatched Easter Sunday bombings plot to influence polls.

title: Musk threatens to sue Anti-Defamation League over X’s falling revenue
description: Billionaire owner of platform formerly known as Twitter says anti-Semitism accusations have hurt company's bottom line.

title: India’s manufacturers cash in as brands seek refuge from US-China tensions
description: Indian firms are capitalising on a push by leading brands to diversify their suppliers away from China.

title: Tens of thousands evacuated in southern China amid relentless rain
description: The rain has broken 12-year-old records in Fuzhou with warnings that 49 reservoirs have exceeded flood limits.

title: Can a divided G20 still set the global agenda?
description: It represents 85 percent of global GDP. But deep fissures and absent leaders raise questions about its future.

title: Home away from home: South Asian vendors in an ancient Omani market
description: South Asian vendors at Muttrah Souq, once Oman’s main commercial centre, have been working there for generations.

title: Russian drone raid kills 1 in Ukraine’s Odesa, Kyiv repels missile attack
description: The night-time attacks on Odesa’s Izmail district lasted three hours, the regional governor said.

title: Three sailors rescued from shark-bitten catamaran off Australia
description: Officials said sharks attacked the inflatable catamaran and tore off large chunks of the vessel's hull.

title: Russian pilot who defected to Ukraine with helicopter gets $500,000 reward
description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, 28, defected with a Mi-8 helicopter in an operation planned with Ukrainian intelligence.

title: Malaysia lifts ban on Australian cattle imports after disease fears eased
description: Australia welcomes announcement as officials say country remains free of lumpy skin disease.

title: UK to declare Russia’s Wagner Group a ‘terrorist’ organisation
description: Designation of the group, condemned as a 'threat to global security', could be made as early as Wednesday.

title: Tunisian police arrest two top officials in Ennahda opposition party
description: Ennahda interim head Mondher Ounissi and Abdel Karim Harouni, leader of the party's Shura Council, have been arrested.

title: ‘Russian-only’ businesses in Thailand’s Phuket spark backlash
description: Locals on tourist resort island claim Russians fleeing fallout of the war in Ukraine are stealing Thai jobs.

title: Two people arrested in China for smashing a hole in the Great Wall
description: Suspects widened a gap in the Great Wall to shorten travel time to a worksite in Shanxi province, state media says.

title: Myanmar rejects ASEAN statement condemning violence as ‘one-sided’
description: Generals lash out after 10-member grouping urges 'Myanmar Armed Forces in particular' to end civilian attacks.

title: At least 5 people killed as rainstorms, floods hit Turkey, Greece, Bulgaria
description: Four people killed in Turkey and Bulgaria and one killed in Greece following flash flooding with several still missing.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 560
description: As the war enters its 560th day, these are the main developments.
